pages.text: $(key)Manipulating souls$() is the core mechanism of the $(#3ea29f)Soul$() School. Using a $(key)Soul Container$() on a low-health mob transforms it into a $(key)Soul Minion$() and seals it within the container. Reusing the container releases the $(key)Soul Minion$(). $(br2)$(key)Soul Minion$() will not attack you and will assist you in combat; otherwise unchanged.

pages.title: Soul Container
pages.text: $(br)Normal $(key)Soul Container$() that fail to convert $(key)Soul Minions$() will enter a $(bold)cooldown$(). $(br2)$(key)Advanced Soul Container$() has a higher success rate when converting $(key)Soul Minions$() and has almost no $(bold)cooldown$() upon failure.

pages.title: Possession
pages.text: Cast $(key)Possess$() on a $(bold)soul minion$() to bind your soul to its body while your $(bold)body$() remains behind. After possession, you can control the $(bold)soul minion$()'s actions and gain some of its $(welcome/key)abilities$(), while retaining your own inventory. $(br2)$(key)Possession$() ends and your soul returns if the $(bold)soul minion$() dies or your $(bold)body$() is near death (retaining $(t:At least 1 heart)$(bold)1%$() health).

pages.title: Release from Possession
pages.text: $(br)You may cast $(key)Possess$() on your $(bold)body$() or cast $(key)Recall$() directly to manually end the $(key)Possession state$().$(br2)Additionally, cast $(key)Soul Command$() on your $(bold)soul minion$() to switch its specific $(bold)behavior mode$().

pages.title: Behavior Modes
pages.text: $(list)$(bold)Move Mode$():$(br)$(list2)$(bold)Follow$(): proactively follow the owner and attempt to teleport when out of range$(br)$(list2)$(bold)Force Follow$(): force follow owner, ignore pathfinding$(br)$(list2)$(bold)Standby$(): stand down. Cease movement and attacks

$(br2)$(list)$(bold)Attack Mode$():$(br)$(list2)$(bold)Default$(): will not attack the owner or allies$(br)$(list2)$(bold)Aggressive$(): will not attack the owner, but may attack allies (such as other soul minions)
